Lack of trust and rapport: When team members feel that they cannot communicate effectively, they may struggle to build trust and rapport, leading to a more challenging work environment.
Difficulty in collaborating: Language barriers can make it challenging for team members to collaborate effectively, leading to missed opportunities for brainstorming and problem-solving.
Resistance to change: Team members may resist changes in the workplace if they do not understand the reasons for the changes or if they feel that their concerns are not being addressed.
Conflict resolution challenges: Language barriers can make it more challenging to resolve conflicts in the workplace, as team members may struggle to express their concerns or needs.
Limited career advancement: Language barriers can limit the career advancement opportunities for employees who struggle to communicate effectively in the workplace.
